inclusion.criterion: diagnosis of chronic incomplete lower dorsal (below Th10) or lumbar spinal cord injury as defined by the American Spinal Injury Association Impairment scale classification (AIS B, C or D)
inclusion.label: unknown
met
inclusion.evidence: quote: 'He was admitted to the intensive care unit to be monitored for 24 hours.'

exclusion.criterion: involvement in any specific program of rehabilitation other than the conventional protocol since his injury
exclusion.label: unknown

exclusion.criterion: contraindications to tDCS such as metal in the head or implanted brain medical devices
exclusion.label: not_met
exclusion.evidence: quote: 'Initial CT angiogram of head and neck reported no acute intracranial findings.'

exclusion.criterion: history of seizure, use of medications containing sodium channel blocker such as carbamazepine and any substance abuse
exclusion.label: unknown

notes: Patient has a history of hypertension, hyperlipidemia, and hypothyroidism. He smokes 1 pack of cigarettes per day for 40 years and consumes 5-6 beers per week.
